subject: RE: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?

messageBody:
RE: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?

The JUnit TestRunner is, by default, in loading mode. That is, modified classes are reloaded, when runnning the test.
This causes problems when using EJBs in the test cases. A ClassCastException occurs with the EJB implementation. Different classloaders are used for the EJB in the test case and the EJB in the application server. To overcome this problem, disable the loading property in the junit.properties file.

Add a junit.properties file for preference settings. It is stored in the folder referred to by the "user.home" property. The supported setting is loading, it can be set to true or false to enable or disable the loading behavior.

On Windows 2000, "user.home" could be C:\Documents and Settings\user
A drawback to disabling the loading behavior, is that modified test cases will require JUnit to be restarted.

Find attached a sample junit.properties file.


Arco.

Subject: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?


We are trying to call EJB in our JUnit, it runs fine normally,
however, if we run it from the TesterRunner of swingui, the
PortableRemoteObject.narrow() method throws a ClassCastException.

Anyone has experienced this problem?
